meanings.definition: To steal or take dishonestly (money or property entrusted to one's care)
meanings.sent1: The dishonest clerk tried to peculate money from the company's safe.
meanings.sent2: The treasurer was caught peculating funds from the charity organization.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon seemed to peculate the cookies from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The thief's eyes seemed to peculate every valuable item in the room.
meanings.sent5: The children's story warned about the consequences of trying to peculate from others.
